availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Porter Lacey (Wolfe County, Kentucky, clerk, justice of the peace, farmer, and postmaster)

body.p: Morgan County and Wolfe County, Kentucky, clerk, justice of the peace, farmer, and postmaster. Kentucky native. Son of Mark Lacy and Sarah "Sally" Huff Lacy. Resident of Morgan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Morgan County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Wolfe County in 1862. Farmer in Wolfe County in 1863. Postmaster of Swiftville in Wolfe County from September 19, 1865, to January 30, 1867.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 153A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, Division 2, p. 441.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wolfe County, Campton, p. 445A.
"Andrew Porter Lacey (1836-1913)," Find A Grave, Memorial #8705352, accessed December 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8705352.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Wolfe County, KY, December 1863, p. 212.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #9300.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Wolfe County, Kentucky, vol. 38, p. 206.
KYR-0001-031-0067.
